alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:51AM EST until December 19 at 3:59AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Waterbury affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Waterbury. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 417.0 feet, The Winooski from Waterbury downstream through Richmond will be at bankful. Some minor flooding of low lying fields will occur. At 419.0 feet, Water will flood fields behind the Vermont State Office Complex in Waterbury. Field flooding will occur from Waterbury downstream through Richmond. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 417.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 419.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 419.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EST.
